alert.note: Alert for Chaffee; Lake (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 2:50PM MST until December 08 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... North central Chaffee County in central Colorado... Lake County in central Colorado... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 249 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Tennessee Pass to Turquoise Lake to Mt Elbert, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Much of Highway 24 in Lake County. Locations impacted include... Leadville, Fremont Pass, Climax, Mt Massive, Twin Lakes, Turquoise Lake, Mt Elbert, Leadville North, and Granite. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
